title: Light Pens: Touching the Screen Before Touchscreens
description: A 60-second lesson on Light Pens: Touching the Screen Before Touchscreens.

hook.text: In 1963, Ivan Sutherland pointed a pen at a screen and drew a perfect line. Sketchpad was born.

buildup.text: The light pen detected the electron beam of a CRT monitor, knowing exactly where you pointed.

climax.text: Every touchscreen, stylus, and digital drawing tablet traces its lineage to Sutherland's light pen.

punchline.text: Direct manipulation was invented in 1963. We just had to wait.

quiz.question: What did Ivan Sutherland's Sketchpad introduce?
options: Direct manipulation of graphics on screen
